content.question: The graph above shows the speed distribution of molecules in a sample of a gas at a certain temperature. Which of the following graphs shows the speed distribution of the same molecules at a lower temperature (as a dashed curve) ?

choices.label: A graph plots Number of Molecules against Speed. The graph shows two curves. A bell curve rises to its maximum from the origin, and falls to the horizontal axis with decreasing steepness. A dashed curve rises from the origin, rises to its maximum, lower than that of the first curve, and falls along the horizontal axis.

A graph plots Number of Molecules against Speed. The graph shows two curves. A bell curve rises to its maximum from the origin, and falls to the horizontal axis with decreasing steepness. A dashed curve rises from the origin, rises to its maximum, inside the first curve, and falls to the horizontal axis with decreasing steepness.

A graph plots Number of Molecules against Speed. The graph shows two curves. A bell curve rises to its maximum from the origin, and falls to the horizontal axis with decreasing steepness. A dashed curve rises from the origin, rises to its maximum, equal and to the right of the first curve, and falls along the horizontal axis.

A graph plots Number of Molecules against Speed. The graph shows two curves. A bell curve rises to its maximum from the origin, and falls to the horizontal axis with decreasing steepness. A dashed curve rises from the origin, rises to its maximum, above and to the left of the first curve, and falls along the horizontal axis.

content.answer: A graph plots Number of Molecules against Speed. The graph shows two curves. A bell curve rises to its maximum from the origin, and falls to the horizontal axis with decreasing steepness. A dashed curve rises from the origin, rises to its maximum, above and to the left of the first curve, and falls along the horizontal axis.

skill.text: 5.D: Identify information presented graphically to solve a problem.
